==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|女|也|c1=s|c2=p|t1=female, woman|ls=psc}}.

Originally a variant of {{zh-l|姐|elder sister}}, later repurposed as a feminine third-person pronoun influenced by European languages. Linguist {{w|Liu Bannong}} is credited with coining this use around 1910s ({{zh-ref|Bi, 2013}}).

===Definitions===
{{zh-hanzi}}

# [[she]], [[her]]
#: {{zh-x|她 去 了。|'''She''' went away.}}
#: {{zh-x|我 認識{shi} 她。|I know '''her'''.}}
#* {{zh-x|那 人 說：「^你 所 賜 給 我、與 我 同居 的 女人，她 把 那 樹 上 的 果子{zi} 給 我，我 就 吃 了。」|And the man said, The woman whom thou gavest to be with me, '''she''' gave me of the tree, and I did eat.|ref={{lang|zh|{{w|新標點和合本|lang=zh}}}} (Chinese Union Version with New Punctuation), {{lang|zh|創世記}} (Genesis) 3:12}}

====Usage notes====
* Occasionally, {{zh-l|他}} may be used for both genders.

===See also===
''No major Chinese dialect distinguishes between “he”, “she” and “it” in spoken form, and Mandarin {{zh-l|他/她/它}} is the only instance where such a distinction is made in written form. Thus see the table below for words for “she” in other varieties of Chinese.''
